overview.summary: Select a subset of a field.

description.p: This module clips out a subset of a field. The new field contains just the selected portion of the input field.

The module runs in one of three different modes. If a field is connected to the "Clip Field" port, the module will clip the input field such that only those elements inside of the clip field are preserved. If Functional Clipping is turned on, then the function specified in the GUI is used to determine which elements are inside of the field. Finally, if no Clip Field is connected and functional clipping is turned off then the GUI widget is used to select which portion of the input field to preserve.

The type of the field is preserved in the clip, as well as the data values if possible. Some field types are structured and thus not clippable. This includes the LatVolField, ImageField, and Scanline field types. There is an Unstructure module that can be used to convert these fields to appropriately unstructured versions before clipping.

The function specified by the functional clipping mode is evaluated as a TCL expression. $x is the variable used for the value in the field. For example, "$x == 0 || $x == 1" will select all of the elements where the data value is equal to 0 or 1.
